scholar.definition: A programming language that enables interactive web pages.
A self-contained file of code that encapsulates related functionality.
A contract that defines the properties and methods an object must implement.
A named storage location for holding a value that can change.
Application software for accessing the World Wide Web.
A collection of related data and/or functionality.
A data structure consisting of a collection of elements.
A set of statements that performs a task or calculates a value.
The set of rules that define the combinations of symbols that are considered to be correctly structured.
An object representing the eventual completion or failure of an asynchronous operation.

architect.definition: A palace and fortress complex located in Granada, Spain.
A city in Andalusia known for its immense Mosque-Cathedral.
The capital of the province of Granada, home to the Alhambra.
A place of worship for Muslims.
A grand residence, especially a royal residence.
The rule or reign of a caliph or chief Muslim ruler.
Generalife is famous for these lush, water-filled spaces.
A curved symmetrical structure spanning an opening.
The branch of mathematics concerned with properties of space, used heavily in Islamic art.
A tall slender tower, typically part of a mosque, with a balcony.
